q: It ain't where you start in life, it's where you end up, and what you did along the way.
h:
“It ain't where you start in life, it's where you end up, and what you did along the way.” —
Colin Powell

q: Life is about accepting the challenges along the way, choosing to keep moving forward, and savoring the journey.
h:
“Life is about accepting the challenges along the way, choosing to keep moving forward, and savoring the journey.” —
Roy T. Bennett

q: The way to get started is to quit talking and begin doing.
h:
“The way to get started is to quit talking and begin doing.” —
Walt Disney

q: You don't have to move mountains. You'll change the world simply by being a warm, kind-hearted human being.
h:
“You don't have to move mountains. You'll change the world simply by being a warm, kind-hearted human being.” —
Anita Krizzan

q: From error to error one discovers the entire truth.
h:
“From error to error one discovers the entire truth.” —
Sigmund Freud

q: Darkness must pass. A new day will come. And when the sun shines, it will shine out the clearer.
h:
“Darkness must pass. A new day will come. And when the sun shines, it will shine out the clearer.” —
J.R.R. Tolkien

q: Through selfless service, you will always be fruitful and find the fulfillment of your desires.
h:
“Through selfless service, you will always be fruitful and find the fulfillment of your desires.” —
Bhagavad Gita

q: When we think about our strengths, we are strong. When we think about our weaknesses, we are weak.
h:
“When we think about our strengths, we are strong. When we think about our weaknesses, we are weak.” —
Peter A. Cohen

q: Most people get ahead during the time that others waste.
h:
“Most people get ahead during the time that others waste.” —
Henry Ford

q: Each day your life grows a day shorter. Make every move count.
h:
“Each day your life grows a day shorter. Make every move count.” —
Ming-Dao Deng

q: Everything you've ever wanted is on the other side of fear.
h:
“Everything you've ever wanted is on the other side of fear.” —
Brian Tracy

q: Surround yourself only with people who are going to take you higher.
h:
“Surround yourself only with people who are going to take you higher.” —
Oprah Winfrey

q: Being In The Present Means Tuning Out Distractions And Paying Attention To What Is Important, Now.
h:
“Being In The Present Means Tuning Out Distractions And Paying Attention To What Is Important, Now.” —
Spencer Johnson

q: Life moves on and so should we.
h:
“Life moves on and so should we.” —
Spencer Johnson

q: Don't waste your time in anger, regrets, worries, and grudges. Life is too short to be unhappy.
h:
“Don't waste your time in anger, regrets, worries, and grudges. Life is too short to be unhappy.” —
Roy T. Bennett

q: A successful man is one who can lay a firm foundation with the bricks others have thrown at him.
h:
“A successful man is one who can lay a firm foundation with the bricks others have thrown at him. ” —
David Brinkley

q: Do what is right, not what is easy, nor what is popular.
h:
“Do what is right, not what is easy, nor what is popular.” —
Roy T. Bennett

q: It's not what you say out of your mouth that determines your life, it's what you whisper to yourself that has the most power!
h:
“It's not what you say out of your mouth that determines your life, it's what you whisper to yourself that has the most power!” —
Robert Kiyosaki

q: Greatest success comes just one step beyond the point at which defeat overtakes you.
h:
“Greatest success comes just one step beyond the point at which defeat overtakes you.” —
Unknown

q: I will love the light for it shows me the way, yet I will endure the darkness because it shows me the stars.
h:
“I will love the light for it shows me the way, yet I will endure the darkness because it shows me the stars.” —
Og Mandino

q: You are free, and that is why you are lost.
h:
“You are free, and that is why you are lost. ” —
Franz Kafka

q: Prefer to be defeated in the presence of the wise than to excel among fools.
h:
“Prefer to be defeated in the presence of the wise than to excel among fools.” —
Dogen

q: Humor isn't for everyone. It's only for people who want to have fun, enjoy life, and feel alive.
h:
“Humor isn't for everyone. It's only for people who want to have fun, enjoy life, and feel alive.” —
Anne Wilson Schaef

q: Life is either a daring adventure, or it is nothing.
h:
“Life is either a daring adventure, or it is nothing.” —
Helen Keller

q: I will not walk backward in life.
h:
“I will not walk backward in life.” —
J.R.R. Tolkien

q: Monsters are real, and ghosts are real too. They live inside us, and sometimes, they win.
h:
“Monsters are real, and ghosts are real too. They live inside us, and sometimes, they win.” —
Stephen King

q: People who bite the hand that feeds them usually lick the boot that kicks them.
h:
“People who bite the hand that feeds them usually lick the boot that kicks them.” —
Eric Hoffer

q: The river that flows in you also flows in me.
h:
“The river that flows in you also flows in me.” —
Kabir

q: Perplexity is the beginning of knowledge.
h:
“Perplexity is the beginning of knowledge.” —
Kahlil Gibran

q: Nothing external to you has any power over you.
h:
“Nothing external to you has any power over you.” —
Ralph Waldo Emerson

q: Although the world is full of suffering, it is also full of the overcoming of it.
h:
“Although the world is full of suffering, it is also full of the overcoming of it.” —
Helen Keller

q: If we are not able to smile, then the world will not have peace.
h:
“If we are not able to smile, then the world will not have peace.” —
Thich Nhat Hanh

q: Everything flows, nothing stands still.
h:
“Everything flows, nothing stands still.” —
Heraclitus

q: That some achieve great success is proof to all that others can achieve it as well.
h:
“That some achieve great success is proof to all that others can achieve it as well.” —
Abraham Lincoln

q: Work out your own salvation. Do not depend on others.
h:
“Work out your own salvation. Do not depend on others.” —
Buddha

q: We all give up great expectations along the way.
h:
“We all give up great expectations along the way.” —
Carlos Ruiz Zafon

q: The Truth is realized in an instant; the Act is practiced step by step.
h:
“The Truth is realized in an instant; the Act is practiced step by step.” —
Seungsahn

q: Don't spend major time on minor things.
h:
“Don't spend major time on minor things.” —
Jim Rohn

q: All animals except man know that the principal business of life is to enjoy it.
h:
“All animals except man know that the principal business of life is to enjoy it.” —
Samuel Butler

q: We are born from a quiet sleep, and we die to a calm awakening
h:
“We are born from a quiet sleep, and we die to a calm awakening” —
Zhuangzi

q: Everyone must choose one of two pains: The pain of discipline or the pain of regret.
h:
“Everyone must choose one of two pains: The pain of discipline or the pain of regret.” —
Jim Rohn

q: If you chase two rabbits, you catch none.
h:
“If you chase two rabbits, you catch none.” —
Confucius

q: The only time you run out of chances is when you stop taking them.
h:
“The only time you run out of chances is when you stop taking them.” —
Unknown

q: Don't allow your mind to tell your heart what to do. The mind gives up easily.
h:
“Don't allow your mind to tell your heart what to do. The mind gives up easily.” —
Paulo Coelho

q: The future is not a gift. It is an achievement.
h:
“The future is not a gift. It is an achievement.” —
Robert F. Kennedy

q: A golden cage is still just a cage.
h:
“A golden cage is still just a cage.” —
Anita Krizzan

q: Move out of your comfort zone. You can only grow if you are willing to feel awkward and uncomfortable when you try something new.
h:
“Move out of your comfort zone. You can only grow if you are willing to feel awkward and uncomfortable when you try something new.” —
Brian Tracy
